Reviews.Title: Don't buy!
Reviews.Author: msg
Reviews.Content: I bought 4 of these TV's. Within 3 months, two died! yes, two. I had to pay shipping on the first one to send to them which cost me $30 and now I have to pay to send the second one in. I had to wait about 3 weeks to get it back which meant i had to buy another one! this Westinghouse TV is crap. I am thinking about calling the company to ask them for my money back or I will go to court to file for a consumer protection.

Reviews.Title: Avoid this one...read the reviews!
Reviews.Author: Massinbn
Reviews.Content: After reading the recent reviews I felt I should add to the warnings. Bought a Westinghouse 3260 with Costco deal last June and got the Costco 2 year warranty plan so slept well even though brand had limited reviews at the time. It started acting up - jittery screen then black in October. Costco helped me get Westinghouse customer service but got the ship to Texas and pay charges result as other reviews state. After 3 weeks got a replacement that remote would not work on so Westinghouse has sent me a "comparable" replacement - model 3237. My math skills tell me it is a lesser TV based on "lower" model. Guess they had to replace so many 3260's they ran out. Headed back to Vizio if this one tanks!

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy
Reviews.Author: sms527 "Sam"
Reviews.Content: The picture stopped working after a couple of months. Customer service is horrible. They force you to pay to ship the TV to Houston. Avoid this TV at all costs. Go for the name brand, and avoid the headache of a company that will not survive long with faulty products and terrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: Save your money
Reviews.Author: Ricardo
Reviews.Content: Bought it from costco because of the cheap price and the fact that it was led backlight.Worked OK for the first week.During the second week I started to see random stutters of the screen about 2-5 minutes after turning the set on which I thought could have been because of maybe a bad connection with the HDMI cable, I tried other cables but it persisted.At the third week things became unbearable as the screen stuttered, jumped all around, became black for extremely long durations of time(about 10-20 minutes) after which the screen would come back and display stuttering jumping and the whole cycle repeated again till the screen finally became black and wouldn't display anything anymore.Took it back to costco, got my money back and am waiting till black friday to see if I can score a deal with one of those vizio or sony TV.I've been told it's a common problem with these displays. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: You get what you paid for... Reliability is poor.
Reviews.Content: I got mine at Costco, where it was the cheapest in this screen size. I was also attracted by the fact that it was LED, although not full HD resolution. When it worked, it worked fine. Menu was clear and simple, colors were fine. As it turned out, the only thing that was lacking was reliability. The unit lasted only 2 months and died. I guess I got what I paid for. I am so happy that I bought it from Costco - I am taking it back to buy a brand name instead. My recommendation - stay away from it.

Reviews.Title: Don't  Buy!
Reviews.Author: RW
Reviews.Content: TV was only good for about five months and then it started to black out and lines blinking on the screen.  Costco was very good in handling the complaint, but Westinghouse's service was bad. Westinghouse knew from the numerous previous clients complaints the problems were pretty much the same, they should have just asked to mail the TV back to them for repair, instead they required that I take two pictures of the problem and send it to them for review and I had to follow up with the problem. I did get a replacement, but I had to pay the shipping cost and waited almost three weeks for my TV.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy This TV
Reviews.Author: topcop3003
Reviews.Content: This TV is awful but pales in comparison to how bad the customer service is at Westinghouse. The screen crapped out, as many others have said, in the first week.The store (BrandsMart) was no help and just referred me to Westinghouse.Westinghouse refused to service the TV at my house or allow me to take it to a local repair shop. I had to mail the TV back to them AT MY EXPENSE. $70 for nothing. My TV was return a few weeks later with the exact same problem. This time they sent me a shipping label after much complaining. That was months a go and I still have no TV. Customer service keeps saying they will replace it but the TV is on back order. I bought this TV in July and here we are at on January 23rd and still no TV.Finally they are sending me a different model. The agent had no stats on the new TV and there are none posted online. I have no idea if they are actually sending me a similar TV.I will never by another Westinghouse product!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Should have read reviews before buying...ours died too.  What rubbish!
Reviews.Author: Allison Anthony
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV from Costco($250) for the kids tv room for Christmas but kept all the packaging, receipt, etc.Set this up late on 12/24 and exactly one month later we started to see horizontal static bands across the screen.  Thought it was the cables, but not...the static worsened over the last 36 hours to make the tv virtually unwatchable.  Today (1/26) the screen started out with static and then progressed to blanking out completely.I'm packing it up and taking it back to Costco in the morning.  Planning on buying another Panasonic Viera like we have in the other room and have enjoyed without incident for over three years.I've been buying on Amazon for over a decade, and have NEVER written a review of anything.  But the lousy quality of this item begs for me to shout from the rooftops "DO NOT BUY THIS UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCE!!!!"

Reviews.Title: Horrible TV DON'T Buy!!!!
Reviews.Author: FiretruckMD
Reviews.Content: We recieved the TV with a new travel trailer that was installed by the dealer. The trailer had a two year warranty on it, we we thought the TV was covered like all of the other items. Well we found out differently when we took the trailer in for some final warranty work. The dealer was told that the screen on the TV would go on and off. Not a problem until I called 3 weeks later looking for our trailer and found out that they had moved lovations and that the TV only had a 90 day warranty, because it was installed afterwards. We argued with the dealer, but they wouldn't give us any compensation, so we went looking and found the comments for the TV. Horrible TV and Manufacturer support. Something is obviously connected between the comment posts and Westinghouse should compensate all of us with bad TV's!!!!

Reviews.Title: Bought Two - Both Failed!!!
Reviews.Author: HelloItsMe
Reviews.Content: I actually purchased TWO of these Westinghouse TV's.  One failed within 3 months with Vertical Lines and a "Collapsing Screen".  I got that one replaced under warranty and since then it has worked OK.  Now... about 6 months later the other has failed with the EXACT SAME Problem.100% failure rate isn't a very good track record.  I would recommend AVOIDING WESTINGHOUSE TV's!!!

Reviews.Title: never again!
Reviews.Author: rawjawmom
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv in October from Costco.  In March we started to see horizontal lines through the picture.  I started by calling the cable company, but found it to be the tv itself.  Costco concierge service got me in contact with Westinghouse only to give me the run around.  Because I no longer have the box, it could cost me around $90 to return a product that is "covered under warranty". They cannot or will not send me a new tv because they are on back order. If the tv is not repairable I guess I am up a crick since there are no replacements.  Never again will I by a product manufactured by Westinghouse. Buyers be ware!!!

Reviews.Title: The worst TV I ever owned
Reviews.Author: fhayden
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV from CompUSA 5 weeks ago and already it's not working. I can't pick up channels anymore. Possibly a bad tuner card. I also got lines and the picture would go in and out and sometimes make popping sounds. Now it's just a big paper weight. No idea what the popping sounds were about. CompUSA will not help at all because its after product return time limit. They just told me to contact Westinghouse. I called Westinghouse but they have not returned my call as of yet. From this point forward I'm not ever going to buying anything from Westinghouse or anything like a TV from CompUSA again.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS TV!!! YOU ARE WARNED!!!
Reviews.Author: AngryB
Reviews.Content: I PURCHASED THIS TV FROM COSTCO, SAME STORY AS EVERYONE ELSE, A FEW MONTHS LATER TV STOPPED WORKING AND I HAD TO RETURN IT TO WESTINGHOUSE.  THEY SENT ME A RETURN SHIPPING LABEL BUT THE PACKING WOULD HAVE COST ME 75.00CALLED WESTINGHOUSE, THEY OFFERED TO PUT A HOLD ON MY CC AND SEND ME A NEW TV AND I WILL THEN PUT THE OLD TV IN THE SAME PACKAGE AND SEND IT BACK TO THEM, GOOD IDEA! BUT TOO BIG OF A HASSLE FOR THIS TV.  I WISH I WOULD HAVE NEVER PURCHASED IT IN THE FIRST PLACE!!!

Reviews.Title: Same story
Reviews.Author: Briget
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV for our son to take to college.  We bought it in August, it was 100 percent dead in January and we STILL have not been able to get it repaired or refunded through Westinghouse.  It stinks.

Reviews.Title: LIke many said.. a piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Unhappy5
Reviews.Content: I did not buy this from Amazon. I  buy a lot from Amazon. Their subscribers' reviews are the best and most reliable. So I put this review and everywhere that sells this piece of junk TV, to contribute to make sure people do not buy brands that are pieces of  junk.  I bought this new in July 2011. Failed in March 2012. No picture at all. 1 year warranty direct from Westinghouse. Going through the hassle of sending it back. And Westinghouse even forgot to process my RMA for 3 week. Until I call and complain, they did not send me a mailing label to ship the item back. The alternate is to pay them $300 ahead of time and they will ship be a refurb one.  Should I trust them with another $300 charge. No. I will not buy anymore Westinghouse TV. It's too new and not proven. I learn my lesson.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BUY THIS..my first negative review
Reviews.Author: L. Alvarez Armstrong "Ashton A"
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this from Costco. After a few months the horizontal lins  and picture blacking out started occurring. We blamed it on the cable. In the past two days we replaced cables switched cable box and thought we found the problem only for it to return. I decided to go to the web and search and now I know it is not just my TV installation but other owners also have this issue.. I will not recommend Westinghouse or purchase another Westinghouse again. We are now seeing if we can get it fixed or replace it.

Reviews.Title: Believe it.
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV from Best Buy primarily because of the price.  I picked it up for $259, which seemed like a really good deal.  My problems with the TV are:1)  Sound:  It's awful...as in the worst sound quality I've ever experienced on a TV.  I'm fairly certain my phone has better speaker quality.  This isn't a deal breaker though, because it's relatively easy to find an external speaker that's affordable to resolve this issue.2)  Picture:  As many other reviewers have noted, I experienced the dreaded horizontal line problem.  The picture flickers, lines appear, and the picture either returns to normal or disappears entirely.Bottom Line:  I returned the television to Best Buy to fix the horizontal line issue.  I am keeping my fingers crossed that they will junk it and give me store credit.  If so, I will not be purchasing another Westinghouse.

Reviews.Title: So pissed
Reviews.Author: Misty Bohack "Misty"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV in March, 2011 from Wal Mart. Very few reviews on it at the time, but all were good. As of this past month (September, 2013) the picture is gone. Same story as everyone else on here. Rolling picture and lines and then, nothing. Some days are better than others. I am pretty pissed. 2 1/2 years out of a tv? I have a tv (granted it's not a flat screen) from circa 1994 that is still working. What makes me upset is that I paid double for this TV than what it is worth to buy now (if you can even find it) and the repair for it would cost me more than what I paid to replace the TV with a 47 inch LG. Never again will I purchase another Westinghouse TV....

Reviews.Title: Westinghouse LD32"
Reviews.Author: gunn
Reviews.Content: I've been using this product for a couple of months now. Thus far I have no complaints, the picture quality is good, set up of the unit was straight forward and simple enough. We also use the set for gaming and it is a great improvement from the set we had previous. From my experience thus far I got good value for monies spent. I'll recommend this product to anyone who want value for money.

Reviews.Title: Poor sound, minor tweaks, but other than that...
Reviews.Author: A. W. "Red Panda"
Reviews.Content: I got this tv on Black Friday in 2009 for $250.  I've had it for 2 years now and it's worked fine, albeit two small problems:One: The sound quality is poor.  I would watch "Friends" on dvd and noticed immediately that some of the voices, mostly of female characters, would create a buzzing in the tv.  Keeping in mind that I haven't watched anything else that old (circa '94) on dvd, I haven't noticed any buzzing like that since then.  With that said, the sound quality, even without the buzzing, is something you're going to want to upgrade with a sound system if you're at ALL a sound buff.  It's 'acceptable' as is, but you won't be ooohing and aaahing over the sound.Two: The link to the HDMI cable is sometimes lost, but very seldom.  This could also be the Xbox 360 I have hooked up to the other end of the HDMI; I never really found out for sure which end of the cable was giving me trouble.  I used multiple HDMI cables, so I know it isn't the cable itself.  What happens?  The picture will go out temporarily, usually restoring itself in just seconds.  The Xbox 360 will say something to the effect of "HDMI link lost" and then "HDMI link found."  Unfortunately this will sometimes happen 2 to 4 times during an episode.  Then I fiddle with the cable, unplugging it and replugging it, and the problem seems to go away for 4 more months until the tv is moved or repositioned again.Other than those two minor problems, the picture quality is great for the price I paid and I'm happy with the tv.

ProductInfo.Features:
32-inch LED TV features HD 720p resolution,
dynamic contrast  ratio of 100,000:1.
Connectivity includes two HDMI inputs,
1.0" Edge / 2.3" maximum thickness
Uses 10% less energy than a 60 watt light bulb
ProductInfo.Name: Westinghouse 32" Class Edge-lit LED HDTV
